p: Miriam Williams is a Lecturer in Geography and Planning at the Macquarie School of Social Sciences, Macquarie University, Sydney, where she is the course director of the Bachelor of Planning. Her research focuses on care, justice, sustainability and commons in the city. Her current work explores the politics and practices of care through an empirical focus on diverse community food initiatives, high-rise living and sustainable household practice. Miriam’s work has been published in Antipode, Urban Studies, Area, Cities and Geography Compass. Miriam is a member of the Community Economies Institute and Community Economies Research Network.
